titlestmt.titleproper: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Bull family papers (series 30) 1804-1984
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Smith-Houston-Ogden family papers. Bull family papers (series 30)

bioghist.p: The Bull family is allied to the Smith family through the marriage of Gertrude Gouverneur Clemson and Lewis Lawrence Smith. Thomas Bull and Ann Hunter were the parents of Levi Bull. The Rev. Dr. Levi Bull was the founder and lifelong minister of St. Mary's Episcopal Church in Warwick Township. Levi Bull married Ann Jacobs; their daughter Margaretta Jacobs Bull married Rev. John Clemson. Thomas Green Clemson, son of John and Margaretta Clemson, married Sarah Frances Ogden. The daughter of Thomas and Sarah Clemson, Gertrude Gouverneur, married Lewis Lawrence Smith. Gertrude and Lewis Smith were the parents of Lawrence Meredith Clemson Smith, husband of Eleanor Houston Smith.

scopecontent.p: The Bull family papers contain genealogical information on the Bull and Jacobs families; correspondence and photographs related to the Bull family residence in Chester County; manuscript sermons of Levi Bull; and printed materials concerning Levi Bull's life and work.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
